update.description:
This model plugin consumes messages published by `KeyboardGUIPlugin` to control joints in a model. Hopefully the documentation in the header is sufficient to make the usage clear.

Added two worlds using the plugin:

* `worlds/simple_arm_teleop.world`: This is intended as a demo, it uses all 3 kinds of teleop with badly tuned PID

* `test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world`: A few simpler models for testing purposes
update.title: Keys to joints plugin

content.raw: Skipping test: 9f174dd
content.html: Skipping test: 9f174dd

content.raw: I made a feature request for this in #2098
content.html: I made a feature request for this in #2098

content.raw: also, then it would match the behavior of the JointControlWidget
content.html: also, then it would match the behavior of the JointControlWidget

content.raw:
I think the problem with bullet is that this API is probably not thread-safe. It would be more predictable if the `JointController` had a `SetForce` function, since it would run in a thread-safe way, though that would change actually apply a persistent force, rather than an impulse.

I think we can add the `SetForce` API to `JointController` without breaking API. What do you think?
content.html:
I think the problem with bullet is that this API is probably not thread-safe. It would be more predictable if the JointController had a SetForce function, since it would run in a thread-safe way, though that would change actually apply a persistent force, rather than an impulse.

I think we can add the SetForce API to JointController without breaking API. What do you think?

content.raw: I'm seeing the bullet force test fail occasionally. I'll comment inline...
content.html: I'm seeing the bullet force test fail occasionally. I'll comment inline...

content.raw:
Ah nice, thanks! I forgot that gravity is not tied to a physics engine now, was too lazy to write several physics blocks. Made a [PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdf_web_app/pull-requests/1/remove-gravity-from-example-where-it/diff) to fix the example in the SDF spec.

That works perfectly.
content.html:
Ah nice, thanks! I forgot that gravity is not tied to a physics engine now, was too lazy to write several physics blocks. Made a PR to fix the example in the SDF spec.

That works perfectly.

content.raw: Do you mind if I disable gravity in the world file instead of just the tests? I think it will help with debugging: 7648f80407da
content.html: Do you mind if I disable gravity in the world file instead of just the tests? I think it will help with debugging: 7648f80407da

content.raw:
For purposes of this test, I suggest eliminating contact as a source of noise by either of the following:

1. Disable gravity and delete the ground plane (easiest)

2. Make the base joints fixed
content.html:
For purposes of this test, I suggest eliminating contact as a source of noise by either of the following:

  1. Disable gravity and delete the ground plane (easiest)

  2. Make the base joints fixed

oh default parameters...

content.raw:
A better starting viewpoint for the test world:

~~~
diff -r ef08d513dc05 test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world
--- a/test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world	Wed Nov 09 10:33:58 2016 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world	Wed Nov 09 18:00:50 2016 -0800
@@ -4,6 +4,11 @@
 
     <gui fullscreen='0'>
       <plugin name='keyboard' filename='libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so'/>
+      <camera name='user_camera'>
+        <pose frame=''>4.5 0 11 0.000361 1.57 1.57036</pose>
+        <view_controller>orbit</view_controller>
+        <projection_type>perspective</projection_type>
+      </camera>
     </gui>
 
     <include>
~~~
content.html:
A better starting viewpoint for the test world:

diff -r ef08d513dc05 test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world
--- a/test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world  Wed Nov 09 10:33:58 2016 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/keys_to_joints.world  Wed Nov 09 18:00:50 2016 -0800
@@ -4,6 +4,11 @@

     <gui fullscreen='0'>
       <plugin name='keyboard' filename='libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so'/>
+      <camera name='user_camera'>
+        <pose frame=''>4.5 0 11 0.000361 1.57 1.57036</pose>
+        <view_controller>orbit</view_controller>
+        <projection_type>perspective</projection_type>
+      </camera>
     </gui>

     <include>

content.raw: I think the sign on the `scale` parameter could be swapped so that the upper key `i` raises and the lower key `k` lowers, but that's a minor point.
content.html: I think the sign on the scale parameter could be swapped so that the upper key i raises and the lower key k lowers, but that's a minor point.

initialize all of these? i get a compiler warning otherwise:

~~~
[gazebo:make] plugins/KeysToJointsPlugin.cc: In member function ‘virtual void gazebo::KeysToJointsPlugin::Load(gazebo::physics::ModelPtr, sdf::ElementPtr)’:
[gazebo:make] plugins/KeysToJointsPlugin.cc:82:37: warning: ‘ki’ may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
[gazebo:make]            common::PID pid(kp, ki, kd);                                        
[gazebo:make]                                      ^                                         
[gazebo:make] plugins/KeysToJointsPlugin.cc:82:37: warning: ‘kp’ may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
~~~
content.html:
initialize all of these? i get a compiler warning otherwise:
